summary: The Path to Florida Springs National Park Act directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a special resource study to determine the suitability and feasibility of establishing a national park in Central and North Florida. The study area includes a significant portion of land encompassing forests, preserves, and state parks. The Secretary must evaluate the area's national significance, consider preservation alternatives, consult with stakeholders, and identify associated costs. A report with findings and recommendations must be submitted to relevant congressional committees within three years.
